Behavioral.question: What does the Chief of Staff role mean to you?
Why are you interested in becoming a Chief of Staff?
What experience do you have that prepares you for this role?
How would you describe your relationship with the executive you'd support?
Tell me about a time you managed a complex, cross-functional project.
How do you handle confidential or sensitive information?
What's your approach to managing up?
Tell me about a time you identified and solved a strategic problem.
Describe your communication style when working with C-suite executives.
What systems or processes would you implement to improve organizational efficiency?
Tell me about a time you had to make an ethical decision under pressure.
How do you stay productive when managing multiple high-priority initiatives?
Describe a time you resolved a conflict between team members or departments.
How would you help a CEO scale from 50 to 500 employees?
What metrics would you track to measure organizational health?
How do you build relationships with board members?
Tell me about a time you managed a crisis or urgent situation.
How would you structure the CEO's calendar and priorities?
Describe your experience with board meeting preparation and follow-up.
How would you future-proof the organization against industry disruption?
How do you gather and synthesize information from across the organization?
Tell me about a time you had to deliver difficult feedback to a senior leader.
How do you maintain your own professional development while supporting others?
What's your approach to building a culture of accountability?
How do you decide what to delegate vs. what to handle personally?
How do you handle situations where you disagree with the CEO's decision?
Tell me about a time you improved a broken process or system.
